intro: Acetosella confertifolia, commonly known as the clustered sorrel, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its rosette of oval, hairy leaves that are often reddish in color. The plant produces small, yellow flowers clustered together in a terminal inflorescence, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Acetosella confertifolia is a perennial species native to parts of Europe and Asia.
